sentences.english: They are harried, sending out instructions to companies and schools.
sentences.chinese: 他們苦惱不已，不斷向公司和學校發出各種指令。

sentences.english: 'You don't want to quit precipitously since you can traumatize yourself even more by facing extended un employment .
sentences.chinese: 他說，不要倉促離職，因爲長期失業會讓你更加苦惱。

sentences.english: e.g: She poured out her troubles to me over a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她邊喝咖啡邊向我傾訴她的苦惱。

sentences.english: It is really vexing to have to wait a long time for anyone.
sentences.chinese: 長時間等人真是件令人苦惱的事。

sentences.english: France has grappled with this conundrum for years.
sentences.chinese: 法國就已經爲了這個難題苦惱多年。

sentences.english: Fan is very worried about how she will take of her family.
sentences.chinese: 小范爲養家的問題非常苦惱。

sentences.english: As we watch with mounting melancholy the devastation from Sichuan, a question lingers, and troublingly.
sentences.chinese: 當我們看到四川悲劇，腦子裏縈繞著一個苦惱的問題。

sentences.english: Dogs know the meaning and anguish of doors.
sentences.chinese: 狗懂得門的意義及門所帶來的苦惱。

sentences.english: Unhappiness or problems cannot survive in the Now.
sentences.chinese: 所有不快樂或苦惱，都難以在當下活存。

sentences.english: And throughout America the anguished debate roils on.
sentences.chinese: 在個美洲都激盪着這苦惱的爭論。

sentences.english: There's no reason to agonize over telling people you're job hunting.
sentences.chinese: 沒有理由爲告訴他人你正在找工作而感到苦惱。

sentences.english: Your lack of routine upsets this steady sign.
sentences.chinese: 你的不守規矩會讓這個穩如泰山的星座苦惱不安。

sentences.english: To solve small and medium-sized enterprises without professional marketing staff distress.
sentences.chinese: 解決中小型企業無專業營銷策劃人員的苦惱。

sentences.english: Those who use unaccustomed eyebrow pencil you, whether to have some of worry?
sentences.chinese: 用不習慣眉筆的你，是否有些苦惱呢？

sentences.english: The wind of anguish still hauls on them as usual.
sentences.chinese: 苦惱之風依然捲走它們一如往昔。

definition: to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
inconvenient/troublesome/annoying/to trouble or bother sb/to put sb to trouble
